definition: to put to work (servant or animal)/to make use of for labor
forced labor/corvée/obligatory task/military service/to use as servant/to enserf/servant (old)/war/campaign/battle
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
draft animals/beasts of burden

sentences.english: Hence, we give a new expression of Slaving Principle and study its relation to Adiabatic Approximation.
sentences.chinese: 爲此給出了役使原理的新表述，並探討兩者的關係。

sentences.english: No one shall be held in servitude.
sentences.chinese: 任何人不應被強迫役使。

sentences.english: That we're all guilty of using you?" She was distraught."
sentences.chinese: 我們都因爲役使你們而成了罪惡的人？

sentences.english: Man is the only Slave. And he is the only animal who enslaves .
sentences.chinese: 人是唯一做奴隸又役使奴隸的動物。

definition: to order (sb) about/(by extension) to put to use
to urge (sb to do do sth)/to drive (sb to take an action)
to keep (an animal)/to look after the needs of (a person or an animal)/(fig.) to keep (a spy, lackey etc) in one's pay
to enslave/slavery
servant
to raise (animals)
to use (an animal or servant)/working (animal)/(beast) of burden/causative form of verbs (esp. in grammar of Japanese, Korean etc)
to subdue/to vanquish/to tame
variant of 收服[shou1 fu2]
puppet
ghost of sb devoured by a tiger who helps the tiger devour others
to urge/to prompt/to spur on/to order sb about
variant of 駕馭|驾驭[jia4 yu4]
malignant deity/fiend
to fall forward/to fall prostrate
to overawe/to be scared into submission
